intro: Gluta, commonly known as the wild coffee tree, is a tropical plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to Southeast Asia and is characterized by its evergreen leaves and small, white flowers. The plant produces red, fleshy berries that contain a single seed, which is used in traditional medicine. Gluta species are often found in moist, shaded environments within tropical rainforests. Its botanical features make it an important part of the ecosystem and a subject of ecological study.
